name: Marienplatz
description: The 'Point Zero' of Munich. Home to the Glockenspiel and the central Christmas Market (Nov 24 - Dec 24).

name: Neues Rathaus (Tower)
description: Visit the tower for a panoramic view of the city. Don't miss the Juristische Bibliothek inside.

name: Frauenkirche
description: Munich's iconic cathedral. The South Tower offers a 360-degree view.

name: Münchner Residenz
description: The royal palace complex including the Treasury and Cuvilliés Theatre. Plan for 2.5 - 3.5 hours.

name: Hofbräuhaus
description: The world's most famous beer hall. Great for traditional music and a 'Mass' of beer.

name: Deutsches Museum
description: World's largest science museum. Perfect for rainy days. Plan for 4-6 hours. OPEN MONDAYS.

name: Englischer Garten
description: One of the world's largest urban parks. See the surfers at the Eisbachwelle (near Haus der Kunst).

name: Nymphenburg Palace
description: Baroque summer residence. The main palace is open Mondays, but park pavilions close in winter.

name: BMW Welt & Museum
description: BMW Welt is free and futuristic. The Museum (paid) showcases history. Good for rainy days.

name: Alte Pinakothek
description: Old Masters (Rubens, Dürer). CLOSED MONDAYS. Entry is only €1 on Sundays.

name: Pinakothek der Moderne
description: Modern art, design, and architecture. CLOSED MONDAYS. Open late (8pm) on Thursdays. €1 on Sundays.

name: Viktualienmarkt
description: Daily outdoor farmers' market with a beer garden. Great for lunch. Closed Sundays.

name: Olympiapark
description: Site of the 1972 Olympics. Great views from the Olympic Hill. Hosts the Märchenbazar Christmas market.

name: Therme Erding
description: World's largest spa complex. The best place to escape the cold weather. Accessible via S2 (Altenerding).

name: Marienplatz Christmas Market
description: The traditional original. Nov 24 - Dec 24. Best for romantic atmosphere and Glühwein.

name: Residenz Christmas Village
description: Located in the Kaiserhof courtyard of the palace. Nov 17 - Dec 22. Very atmospheric.

name: Tollwood Winter Festival
description: Alternative festival at Theresienwiese. Organic food, crafts, and shows. Nov 25 - Dec 23.

name: Pfarrkirchen Town Square
description: One of the most beautiful squares in Lower Bavaria, lined with colorful Inn-Salzach style houses and arcaded façades from the 16th–17th century.

name: Altes Rathaus
description: Former town hall built around 1500 with a Gothic core and octagonal Renaissance tower. Houses the Tourist Information, Council Chamber, and Local History Museum.

name: Wimmer-Ross
description: Iconic bronze horse statue cast in 1966 by Hans Wimmer. Symbolizes the region’s historic horse-breeding culture.

name: Town Fountain (Stadtbrunnen)
description: Fountain commemorating Pfarrkirchen’s city status (1862). Decorated with Easter garlands and lit as an Advent crown in winter.

name: Ringallee
description: A unique one-kilometer chestnut-lined avenue following the old city walls, planted in 1876.

name: Roter Turm
description: Polygonal brick tower once part of the medieval defensive wall. One of the five original city towers.

name: Stadtpfarrkirche
description: Catholic parish church with roots in the Romanesque era, expanded in the 15th century. Features a 67-meter tower and a copper-silver sculpture of the Risen Christ.

name: Wallfahrtskirche Gartlberg
description: Twin-towered Baroque pilgrimage church built between 1661 and 1715. Offers extensive views and includes the 15 Stations of the Cross footpath.

name: Heimatmuseum Pfarrkirchen
description: Local history museum with archaeological, folkloric, and craft objects. Limited opening hours: Tuesdays 14:00–16:00.

name: Hans-Reiffenstuel-Haus
description: Cultural center dedicated to painter Hans Reiffenstuel. Hosts free art exhibitions and features a permanent display of native animals.

name: Trabrennbahn Pfarrkirchen
description: Bavaria’s first sulky race track and the oldest in the region. Hosts annual Pentecost races including the Bavarian Breeders Race.

name: Rottauen
description: Recreational wetlands along the Rott River with educational nature paths. Contains the 'Loreley of the Rott' sculpture.

name: Pfarrkirchen Adventure Pool
description: Family-friendly pool complex with double waterslides, a wild-water river channel, and children's pools.

name: Rottaler Volksfest
description: Local folk festival from April 9–13, 2025 with a heated beer tent and free entrance.

name: Bruckbaam
description: Unique regional dish: thick noodles made from potato dough, fried in clarified butter and served with sauerkraut or apple sauce.

name: Altes Magistrat
description: Historic tavern offering Bavarian cuisine and local specialties.

name: Bad Birnbach – Rottal Terme
description: A rural Bavarian spa town known for the extensive Rottal Terme thermal complex, including the Vitarium and saunas. Easy day trip from Pfarrkirchen.

name: Burghausen – World’s Longest Castle
description: A medieval town dominated by the world’s longest castle (1,051 m). Beautiful ridge walk, old town, and lake scenery.

name: Braunau am Inn
description: A quiet Austrian town across the bridge from Simbach. Known for its medieval center and the spacious Austrian-style Stadtplatz.

name: Passau – The City of Three Rivers
description: A baroque city where the Danube, Inn, and Ilz rivers meet. Home to St. Stephen’s Cathedral with the world’s largest organ and the hilltop fortress Veste Oberhaus.

name: Landshut – The Brick Gothic Capital
description: A wealthy medieval city with a stunning gabled Altstadt. Highlights include St. Martin’s Church (tallest brick tower in the world) and Trausnitz Castle.
price: Free to explore; castle & church tours €4–€8

name: Salzburg
description: An imperial-feeling Alpine city known for Mozart, the Hohensalzburg Fortress, elegant baroque streets, and monastery beer halls.

name: Regensburg – UNESCO Medieval City
description: Germany’s best-preserved large medieval city, home to the 12th-century Stone Bridge, Roman ruins, and the world-famous Wurstkuchl sausage kitchen.

name: Bavarian Forest National Park
description: A deep primeval forest with wildlife, hiking trails, and the famous Baumwipfelpfad tree-top walk in Neuschönau.

name: Lake Chiemsee – Herrenchiemsee & Fraueninsel
description: Bavaria’s largest lake with boat trips to Herreninsel (Versailles-style palace) and the peaceful monastic Fraueninsel.

name: Schärding – The Baroque Jewel
description: Known for the Silberzeile, a row of brightly colored baroque merchant houses. Quiet, picturesque river town south of Passau.

name: Geinberg Spa Resort
description: A premium Austrian thermal resort with warm lagoon pools, saunas, and a tropical-style saltwater area.
